summary: Betty Lou Sisson is identified as a staff member of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). Her name appears on multiple payroll certifications for the committee, specifically for the months of October and November 1977, and May 1978. These documents list her position and salary during those periods. Additionally, her name is included in a JFK Assassination System Identification Form, which contains correspondence, fingerprint analysis reports, and fingerprint cards related to background checks conducted on HSCA staff and applicants.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Betty Lou Sisson's significance lies in her role as a staff member of the HSCA, the committee tasked with investigating the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. Her presence on payroll documents and background check materials indicates her involvement in the operations of the committee, though the specific nature and extent of her contributions are not detailed in these documents.
